other_tests.findings: Left ventricular ejection fraction of 32% and dilatation of the left atrium and left ventricle, without intracardiac thrombus, valvular disease, or intracardiac shunting.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Left ventricular ejection fraction improved to 31% at a later assessment.

other_tests.findings: Nerve-conduction studies were essentially normal; however, electromyography revealed abnormal spontaneous activity and short-duration motor-unit potentials with altered amplitude.
Mild variation in fiber size, a few angulated and atrophic fibers, slight increase in endomysial cellularity, and a macrophage infiltrate, with no evidence of necrosis.
Autoantibody titer was more than 200 IU per milliliter, indicative of statin-associated myopathy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The level of autoantibodies to HMGCR has markedly declined during follow-up.
